column5: Common sense tells me those teenagers don't have any.
lol that's one way of becoming a statistic
too narrow a boat/canoe to be doing that....even if it looks like fun
how did they get back to shore? maybe they had some paddles ...i hope..  ...otherwise...he he he
I probably would have done that when I was a teenager as well.

There were two smart ones amongst them anyhow.. the guys that let them go.. and yah, I did worse as a teen and even a preteen. We were probably 8 or 9 when we use to dare each other to touch open water on the Rideau.. on the current INTAKE side behind the Mariner Inn!
Impressive but as a parent it makes me nervous.  To them its worth the risk if they get enough "likes" on facebook.
Who give a hoot about the paddles, you fall into the water wearing those clothes and you sink like a brick.
I hate to say it but i might still take part in that right now...let alone 10-15 years ago when it would have been a guarentee. Might have put a pfd on though
For better or worse i choose to live here i wasnt born here...
OK, I have been craving to get out on open water - but not like that!
